#â€‹695 â€” July 4, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

How to Annul Promises in JavaScript â€” You can 'cancel' XHR and fetch requests, but can you cancel regular promises? Currently, no, but Zachary looks into doing the next best thing: telling a promise the game's up, and discarding/ignoring its eventual results.

Zachary Lee

regex 2.1: Turn JavaScript's Regular Expression Support Up to Eleven â€” From the co-author of Oâ€™Reillyâ€™s High Performance JavaScript and Regular Expressions Cookbook comes an enhancement for JavaScriptâ€™s regex support. Supporting all of ES2024â€™s regex functionality, it adds support for free spacing and comments, atomic groups, regex subroutines, context-aware interpolation of RegExp instances, and more.

Steven Levithan

ğŸ’¡ The author also tells us a Babel plugin for regex is expected to be released later today.

âœ‚ï¸ Cut Your QA Cycles Down to Minutes with Automated Testing â€” Are slow test cycles bottlenecking your dev teams' release velocity? With QA Wolf , your organization can run entire test suites in minutes, not days. Plus, get to 80% automated E2E coverage in just 4 months (zero flakes, guaranteed). Schedule a demo.

QA Wolf sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Nicholas C. Zakas writes about different JavaScript runtimes and how you can preserve the ability to switch runtimes easily.

  • The React Native team says developers building modern React Native apps should be using a framework to do so, such as Expo.

  • Web pioneer Marc Andreessen tells â–¶ï¸ the origin story of Mosaic and Netscape.

  • ğŸ¤¦ If you can't get your Lighthouse scores to 100%, you could always pretend.. A trick to keep an eye out for..

  • There are at least 535 ways to reload a page with JavaScript.

RELEASES:

  • Backbone.js 1.6 â€“ The classic library gets a little update.

  • Qwik 1.6 â€“ Qwik 2 is coming soon, though.

  • A raft of Node.js Security Releases are due on July 8.

  • ESLint 9.6, PrimeVue 4.0, Bun 1.1.18

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

Enhancing The New York Times' Web Performance with React 18 â€” Last year, The New York Times set out to take full advantage of React 18 on its flagship news site. This is a tour of the challenges faced in upgrading, coupled with the significant benefits they managed to take advantage of.

Ilya Gurevich (NYT)

How to Use a Go(lang) Library from JavaScript with WebAssembly â€” Compiling Go code to WebAssembly opens up some interesting opportunities in the browser.

Thomas Derflinger

Inside Look: How Sentry Debugs with Sentry â€” Join Sentry engineer Yagiz Nizipli to learn how he optimizes tasks with Sentry, saving $160K/yr. RSVP for tips & tricks!

Sentry sponsor

How We Tamed Node.js Event Loop Lag â€” Node famously uses very few threads yet can handle a large number of clients performantly, as long as the work associated with each client is â€˜small.â€™ When that work isn't 'small', as here, things can go off the rails quickly.

Eric Allam

How People with Disabilities Use the Web â€” Describes tools and approaches that disabled people use to interact with the Web and the barriers these people face. Of interest are the user personas that show the range of specific peopleâ€™s experiences.

W3C

A Set of Modern Web Performance Guides â€” A helpful collection of guides, covering things such as working with the different core web vitals, JavaScript optimization, metrics, and more.

SpeedCurve

ğŸ“„ Why Google Sheets Ported Its Calculation Worker from JS to WasmGC Thomas and Steiner (Google)

ğŸ“„ Working with Pasted Content in JavaScript Raymond Camden

ğŸ“„ How to Parse HTML Programatically in JavaScript Brian Wachira

ğŸ“„ TypeScript 5.5: A Blockbuster Release Dan Vanderkam

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

BWIP-JS: A Barcode Writer in Pure JavaScript â€” A library that can generate barcodes using over 100 different barcode types and standards, both single and two dimensional. There is, of course, a live demo where you, too, can discover far more types of barcodes exist than you ever imagined.

Mark Warren

Superstruct 2.0: Define Interfaces to Validate Data at Runtime â€” Designed for validating data at runtime with an annotation API inspired by TypeScript, Flow, Go and GraphQL. GitHub repo.

Ian Storm Taylor

Software Consultants Your Team Actually Wants to Work with ğŸ¥³ â€” Test Double solves tough problems from strategy to execution. Weekly rates. Open contracts. No management required.

Test Double sponsor

Termino.js 2.0: Create Terminal-Like Experiences in the Browser â€” No dependencies, customizable, and you can create multiple terminal instances on a single page. Demos.

Marketing Pipeline

Fabric.js 6.0: A SVG-to-Canvas and Canvas-to-SVG Library â€” Provides an interactive object model on top of the HTML5 canvas to make it easier to work with multiple visual elements there. The homepage is a complete live demo.

Fabric.js

Flitter: A Flutter-Like JavaScript Data Visualization Framework â€” Boasts a declarative syntax and support for both SVG and Canvas to allow you to build high-performance data visualizations, interactive charts, diagrams, and more. Itâ€™s also easy to integrates with React, Svelte, etc.

Flitter

SquirrellyJS 9: A Powerful Template Engine â€” A modern, configurable, and fast template engine promising â€œthe power of Nunjucksâ€ and â€œthe simplicity of EJSâ€. Thereâ€™s an online playground if you want to see it in action. GitHub repo.

Ben Gubler

  • Hexo 7.3 â€“ Popular Node.js blog framework / generator.

  • gridstack.js 10.3 â€“ Build responsive interactive dashboards quickly.

  • React-PDF 9.1 â€“ React component to display PDFs.

  • MUI X 7.8 â€“ Popular React component suite.

ğŸ And one for fun

Sliderland: A Minimalist Coding Playground â€” A slider control based visualization you can code with simple formulas. We last linked to this a few years ago, but itâ€™s still a fun way to do some quick, visual JS math experimentation. Tixy.land is along similar lines, but based on a 2D grid.

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Look at JavaScript's New Set Methods â€” Finding the intersection, union, and difference between sets, among other set-related tasks, is now a piece of cake. Available in Node 22+, Chrome/Edge 122+, Firefox 127+, Safari 17+, and now considered a 'baseline' feature.

Brian Smith (MDN)

Ecma International Approves ECMAScript 2024: Whatâ€™s New? â€” This week, the Ecma General Assembly approved the latest ECMAScript / JavaScript language spec, officially making it a standard. As with ECMAScript 2023, itâ€™s a small step forward, but Dr. Axel looks at whatâ€™s new.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Create Consistent UIs with Storybook â€” Join Steve Kinney for this extensive video course on building scalable, reusable component libraries and design systems with Storybook. Covers set up, styling, documentation, testing, and more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.5 â€” One of the most significant TypeScript releases in terms of features in a long time. Thereâ€™s support for the new Set methods (mentioned above), regex syntax checking, isolated declarations, inferred type predicates, and more. A bumper packed release post.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ“Š Socket's Sarah Gooding has put together a good, easily-skimmed roundup of the State of JS 2023 survey results.

  • ğŸ§Š Someone's created an ASCII 3D renderer in JavaScript. Why? Why not! There's a live demo here.

RELEASES:

  • Playwright 1.45.0 â€“ Microsoft's browser/Web automation library now has a clock API for manipulating time within tests to verify time-related behavior.

  • Bun v1.1.16 â€“ The fast JavaScript runtime and toolkit.

  • Astro 4.11, Electron 31.1, PouchDB 9.0, Node.js v20.15.0 (LTS)

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

ğŸ‘‘ Recreating the Queens Game in Vue â€” Queens is a puzzle game that combines elements of Minesweeper, chess, and Sudoku.

Fotis Adamakis

Understanding React Compiler â€” The new, experimental tool from the React team automates your performance tuning by rewriting your code â€” but should you use it, and how does it work under the hood? Tony takes a look.

Tony Alicea

Local-First Development Will Be Unlocked by Sync Engines â€” Sync engines are behind the amazing UX of apps like Linear and Figma. PowerSync is a plug-in sync engine for web apps.

PowerSync sponsor

Uniting Web and Native Apps with 4 Lesser-Known JavaScript APIs â€” Looks at some 'under-the-radar' web features, such as the Screen Orientation API and Contact Picker API, and how they can be used to create user friendly PWAs.

Juan Diego RodrÃ­guez

Exploring Randomness in JavaScript â€” Specifically, Math.random() versus Crypto.getRandomValues().

Ben Nadel

Drawing the Auth Owl at Userfront | Transformational Auth & Identity â€” Read the story behind Userfront. Including the vision behind the company and what auth should (and shouldn't) have.

Userfront sponsor

ğŸ“„ Slack's AI-Powered Conversion from Enzyme to React Testing Library â€“ If the robots are taking jobs, at least they're the jobs that we often don't want to do.. Sergii Gorbachov (Slack)

ğŸ“„ How to Mock a Child Component When Writing Angular Tests Casey Falkowski

ğŸ“„ Morphing Arbitrary Paths in SVG Alexandru-Gabriel IcÄƒ

Node-RED 4.0 Released â€” Node-RED is a popular â€˜low codeâ€™ event-driven app development environment that uses Node.js behind the scenes. v4.0 requires Node 18 or up, improves its â€˜multiplayerâ€™ support (when multiple users are working on the same system), faster deploys, and other all-round improvements.

OpenJS Foundation

React-Admin v5 â€” A MIT-licensed framework for building React apps on top of REST or GraphQL APIs. You get some added structure and numerous building blocks out of the box. GitHub repo.

FranÃ§ois Zaninotto

Deploy Your SSR Apps on AWS, Fast â€” Deploy any frontend framework quickly with AWS Amplify hosting. Scale to millions? âœ… Branch deployment? âœ… PR previews? âœ…

AWS Amplify sponsor

wavesurfer.js: Audio Waveform Player Library â€” Get responsive and customizable waveforms that provide a visual impression of audio. There are plugins for working with timelines, recording, rendering spectrograms, and more. Many examples here.

katspaugh

PixelMatch 6.0: A Fast Pixel-Level Image Comparison Library â€” Give it two images, itâ€™ll highlight the differences. Now distributed as a ES module.

Mapbox

ğŸ“„ PDFSlick: View and Interact with PDFs â€” An interesting PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JavaScript apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for loaded documents. Live demos.

Vancho Stojkov

  • OverlayScrollbars 2.9 â€“ JS custom scrollbar plugin.

#â€‹693 â€” June 20, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Results of the State of JavaScript 2023 Survey â€” It feels odd including something about 2023 in June 2024, but the results of the major annual JavaScript developer survey are now out. Itâ€™s interesting to see what features JS devs do and donâ€™t use, changes in library popularity over time, what build tools people are using, the divide between JavaScript and TypeScript usage, and much more besides.

Devographics

How JavaScript is Finally Improving the Module Experience â€” Multiple long-term proposals collectively known as â€œmodule harmonyâ€ will complete the features lost as developers move away from CommonJS.

Mary Branscombe / The New Stack

Simplify Your Data Collection with a Fully Integrated Form Management Platform â€” SurveyJS is an open-source JavaScript library suite for secure form creation and data collection in your app. Build JSON-driven surveys/forms quickly, without manual coding. Integrate with any backend system, gather and store responses while retaining full control over your data.

SurveyJS sponsor

How React 19 (Almost) Made the Internet Slower â€” Even changes that are planned in advance can have big effects on the developer experience if people arenâ€™t aware of them. A change to Suspense in React 19 led to much confusion and surprise, but the story has a happy ending with the React team ready to listen to end users more closely.

Henrique Yuji

IN BRIEF:

  • Evan You, the creator of Vue.js, recently gave â–¶ï¸ a talk on 10 years of Vue, covering both its past and future.

  • Over on Twitter/X, Daniel Lemire showed off a situation where Bun is much faster than Node.js, even when both are using the same underlying library, due to the complexities the V8 engine introduces.

  • ğŸµ Did you know TC39 now has its own pop group and a song?

RELEASES:

  • htmx 2.0 â€“ The popular 'access lots of JS and Web API features via special HTML attributes' library gets a new major version mainly to remove deprecations and drop IE support.

  • Electron 31 â€“ The cross-platform desktop app framework steps up to Chromium 126, Node 20.14, and V8 12.6.

  • Relay 17 â€“ Facebook's declaritive GraphQL client for React.

  • ESLint 9.5, Serverless Framework v4, pnpm 9.4

Your Fastest Path to Production â€” Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease â€“ from your first user to your billionth.

Render sponsor

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

â–¶  3D in TypeScript with Raycasting â€” Raycasting is a somewhat old fashioned technique to render 3D environments (you may have seen it in 1992â€™s Wolfenstein 3D) but itâ€™s easy to understand and worth implementing at least once.

Tsoding Daily

Live Types in a TypeScript Monorepo â€” Several strategies to make a TypeScript monorepo feel more â€œaliveâ€ in the sense of the propagation of changes.

Colin McDonnell

Intro to Sentry & Codecov: Live Demo â€” From pre to post-release, learn how Sentry help developers find and fix errors and slowdowns and deploy with confidence.

Sentry sponsor

What Happens When a Major npm Library Goes Commercial? â€” The ua-parser-js library is commonly used to parse user agent strings and gets over 12 million downloads a month, but it has recently switched to AGPL+commercial licensing.

Matteo Collina

Dual Publishing ESM and CJS Modules with tsup and 'Are the Types Wrong' â€” tsup makes it easy to bundle TypeScript libraries and 'Are the Types Wrong?' analyzes packages for issues with their types.

John Reilly

ğŸ“„ How to Use Google Sheets as a 'Database' from React Paul Scanlon

ğŸ“º How Svelte and RSCs are Changing Web Development â€“ A group discussion including Svelteâ€™s Rich Harris, Tracy Lee, Ben Lesh, and Adam Rackis. This Dot Media

ğŸ“„ Mastering Date Formatting using Intl.DateTimeFormat Rafael Camargo

ğŸ“„ MobX Memoizes Components (You Don't Need React Compiler) â€“ If youâ€™re actually using MobX, that is. Mike Johnson

ğŸ“„ Refactoring a Scroll-Driven Animation from JavaScript to CSS Andrico Karoulla

ğŸ“„ UUIDv7 Implemented in 20 Languages â€“ Surprisingly short and sweet. Anton Zhiyanov

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Phoenix: A macOS Window Manager You Can Script with JS â€” macOS is set to adding more window management features in Sequoia, but how about something you can script entirely with JavaScript right now? GitHub repo.

Kasper Hirvikoski

JSONEditor: A Component for Viewing and Editing JSON â€” If your app needs to let users work with JSON directly, this is worth a look. It supports both text and tree views and is cross browser compatible. Live demo.

Jos de Jong

Transformational Auth & Identity | Userfront â€” "Compared to our previous experiences in the security/auth space, Userfront is an order of magnitude simpler to use."

Userfront sponsor

Rooster v9.6: Microsoft's Framework-Independent Rich Text Editor â€” A rich-text editor control neatly nested inside a single div element (demo). Several years old, but still maintained.

Microsoft

NLUX: A Library for Rendering Conversational AI Experiences â€” If you want to spin up a ChatGPT-style conversational experience on top of your own services or third party AI backends, this provides the pieces needed to get an interface up quickly. GitHub repo.

Salmen Hichri

âš™ï¸ NodeSwift â€“ Bridges Node.js and Swift so you can write Swift code that talks to Node and vice versa. Kabir Oberai

âš™ï¸ Vuesion â€“ Boilerplate for Next/Vue app development. Werner-Most Ideen GmbH

âš™ï¸ Kitbag Router â€“ Type safe router for Vue.js. Craig Harshbarger

QUICK RELEASES:

  • Electron Store 10.0 â€“ Simple data persistence for Electron apps.

  • React Date Picker 7.1 â€“ Simple date picker component. (Demo.)

  • Monads 0.7 â€“ Rust-inspired Option, Result, and Either types.

  • Plasmo 0.88 â€“ "Like Next.js for browser extensions."

  • MUI X 7.7 â€“ Popular React component suite.

  • React Tag Autocomplete 7.3
